Shrugs off Matt’s apology for not stopping the house and art from being sold by saying 'I'm over it' but contradicts with 'I'm not.'
Pulls the sunglasses away from Matt and confidently claims them as his own, then puts them on.
Admits he hasn't been to Los Angeles but claims to love it.
Expresses sympathy for Maureen but states he does not trust her, showing situational awareness.
Relies on Matt to help him walk and asks for assistance instead of trying to manage alone.
Thanks Matt for helping and acknowledges his care gratefully.
Prepares and serves breakfast to Harold despite his limited mobility, indicating initiative.
Honest self-reflection about his father's life and legacy.
Shows thoughtful recognition of complex family dynamics and artistic talent.
Abruptly insists he won't leave New York for good, despite uncertain future plans.
